item.title: Two-versus-two tag-team fighting game Saturday AM: Battle Manga announced
item.content:encoded:
• PC

From Netcode Warriors developer Son Studios.

Son Studios, the studio behind the upcoming anime-inspired arena fighting game Netcode Warriors, have announced Saturday AM: Battle Manga, a two-versus-two tag-team fighting game featuring characters from Saturday AM manga like Apple Black, Clock Striker, Massively Multiplayer World of Ghosts, and Soul Beat. Platforms and a release date were not announced, but all major console and PC platforms are under consideration.

“For eleven years, Saturday AM has focused on crafting deep stories with fresh perspectives from a range of nationalities and cultures,” said Saturday AM founder and publisher Frederick L. Jones in a press release. “Anime aside, there is something so rich about giving our fans a chance to interact with our characters in such a dynamic, interactive manner as a videogame and we’re thrilled to do so with an amazing group like Son Studios.”

Son Studios CEO and game director Jesse Segun-Oside added, “The tag fighter space is one I’ve loved since childhood and always dreamed of leading a project in. Kicking things off with these characters is the perfect way to bring that vision to life—with impact.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Son Studios:

About

Saturday AM: Battle Manga brings fan-favorite original manga characters from Apple Black, Clock Striker, Massively Multiplayer World of Ghosts, Soul Beat, and others into an accessible but mechanically rich tag fighter. Each fighter offers a completely distinct game-play feel, with easy-to-learn controls built around classic motion inputs and competitive depth built in.

The game features stylized visuals with boutique animation techniques to capture an expressive, manga-like presentation unique to each of the original artists, evoking the aesthetic of panel-driven storytelling while keeping game-play crisp and readable.

Key Features

  • Two-versus-two tag battles that emphasize creativity, adaptability, and team synergy.
  • Each character designed with unique mechanics and play styles—no clones.
  • Stylized 2.5D visuals utilizing limited animation for a bold, manga-inspired look.
  • Built for both casual enjoyment and competitive mastery.

item.title: Never Grave: The Witch and The Curse drops Early Access release, adds PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, and Switch versions
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

2D Metroidvania roguelike from Pocketpair.

2D Metroidvania roguelike action game Never Grave: The Witch and The Curse will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store as a full release, rather than its previously planned Early Access release, Pocketpair Publishing and developer Frontside 180 Studio announced. The console versions are newly announced. An official release date is still to be announced.

Get the latest details below.

■ Official Release Version (Version 1.0) Announced

It has been decided that Never Grave: The Witch and The Curse, originally planned as an Early Access title, will instead launch directly as the official version 1.0 release!

Due to the valuable feedback from many players during the demo period, we have decided to deliver the game in its complete form, rather than in staged Early Access. The development team is currently making final adjustments to ensure that you receive the best gaming experience from day one. Stay tuned!

■ Multi-Platform Release and Cross-Play!

In addition to the Steam version, we have decided to release the game for Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and Microsoft Store. In addition, it will support cross-play between all platforms, allowing multiplayer across all devices.

■ About the Game

A Metroidvania x roguelike game where you adventure together with a cursed hat. Use a variety of magic to destroy possessed enemies! Bring back loot, build your own village, live your life, and strengthen your abilities for the next battle! Supports up to 4-player multiplayer.

Authentic 2D action

Identify enemy attacks, fight with magic, and sometimes use the terrain to win! Dungeons such as ruins and botanical gardens are auto-generated and change each time you play. Furthermore, there are obstacles and puzzles waiting to block the player’s path in the dungeons.

Possession System

Possess enemies using a cursed hat. Use unique abilities from your possessed enemies to open up avenues of action and gain an advantage in battle!

Rebuild a Ruined Village

Use materials collected in the dungeons to clear the rubble of ruined villages, build new facilities and cultivate crops in the fields. Produce food and potions in the village to prepare for the next battle!

Multiplayer

Multiplayer support for up to four players. Call your friends from other worlds and conquer dungeons together!

Key Features

  • Metroidvania x roguelite with an emphasis on exploration.
  • Sophisticated and tactilely designed player character controls.
  • Possession system where hats can possess enemies and use their unique abilities.
  • Traditional Japanese hand-drawn limited animation is used for character 2D animation.
  • Thickly painted backgrounds with depth, as if you are travelling through a world of picture books and　cut-out pictures.
  • Learn actions such as double-jump from artefacts to explore new areas.
  • Constantly changing play style depending on the synergy of “traits” associated with magic and items.
  • Intense battles with tough bosses. It will take more than just memorizing boss patterns to defeat　them without taking damage…
  • Rebuild your village. Strengthen yourself through building and production to prepare for the next adventure.
  • Explore different terrain each time you play through procedurally generated dungeons.
  • Multiplayer support. Up to four players can delve into the dungeon together!

View a set of screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, and Switch delayed to first two weeks of July
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

PC version still due out on June 26.

Nightdive Studios has delayed the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Switch versions of System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster from their previously planned June 26 release date to sometime in the first two weeks of July. The PC version will still launch via Steam, Epic Games Store, GOG, and Humble Store on June 26.

Here is the full message from Nightdive Studios on the delay:

We have encountered issues that have prevented us from launching System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster on consoles, including Xbox, Switch, and PlayStation, on June 26 as originally intended.

We’re currently working to address these issues as quickly as possible.

Because of this, we’ve made the difficult decision to proceed with the game’s release on PC platforms (Steam, GOG, Epic, Humble) on June 26, with the console release now targeting the first two weeks of July.

We’ll update everyone as soon as we have a set launch date for consoles.

—Nightdive Team
